rooms.description: A grand entrance hall with an open design to lead guests into the villa. Features a welcoming area with built-in seating and local artisan decor, incorporating Vastu principles by aligning the entrance north-east.

An expansive living area that opens directly into the outdoor balcony space. The open-plan design integrates contemporary furnishings, large windows for natural light, and a layout that respects both Brutalist aesthetics and Vastu principles of energy flow.

A fully-equipped open kitchen adjoining the living area with ample counter space, state-of-the-art appliances and integrated storage. Designed to maintain clean lines consistent with Brutalist design yet incorporating natural stone elements inspired by Indian architecture.

The master bedroom features a large balcony offering panoramic views of the cityscape or countryside, ensuring privacy and adherence to Vastu principles in its directional alignment. Furnishings are minimal yet luxurious, complementing the Brutalist aesthetic.

A versatile space that serves as a studio apartment with multifunctional zones including a workspace area, relaxation zone and integrated storage solutions. The layout is optimized for efficient use of space in a penthouse villa setting.

openings.description: A robust, modern front door with reinforced security features, designed to welcome guests while maintaining the Brutalist visual theme. Located on the north-east to align with Vastu principles.
Multiple balcony access points in bedrooms and living areas that provide expansive outdoor views, ensuring natural ventilation and adherence to Vastu guidelines for energy balance.

garage.description: A two-car garage integrated into the ground floor layout. Constructed with robust materials typical of Brutalist design, including exposed concrete and steel accents.
